body: Here is the stack dump, just in case we need it later. Looks like a relatively simple fix. 01-19 00:42:59.836 3257-3257/com.example.karenlee.app E/AndroidRuntime: FATAL EXCEPTION: main Process: com.example.karenlee.app, PID: 3257 There was a specific thing I set for the xml files for this! :) I'll try to
see into this tonight. (Finally, I can take a  break from 410) Also, in
order for this to happen we probably should have texts intead of image
buttons I suppose?
On Jan 19, 2016 4:31 PM, "Bryce Willey" notifications@github.com wrote:

> [image: screenshot_2016-01-19-15-58-31]
> https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6252212/12434049/e35d0acc-bec9-11e5-879c-710767bc43f3.png
> 
> As shown by the pic, all screen assets don't change with screen
> orientation. This will require a complete change in the UI, or having more
> screen backgrounds on the app (won't fix aspect ratio changes though).
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/jemitk/Pacer/issues/2.

Sounds good to me.  And yeah, changing to buttons would probably be best. I was imagining taking the buttons that already exist and putting their background colors to match the color, try to match the font as close as you can, etc.

Made some progress with my [latest commit](https://github.com/jemitk/Pacer/commit/7cf3c57f16727767fdfafee95bc0772132414788), but as it states in the commit, the app now doesn't show dialogues when it should, and the system never seems to call the onPermissionRequestResult method, meaning that the app doesn't work for the current session, although it will work fine once the user has restarted the app. Leaving this issue open until those two issues are fixed.

Also, another thing regarding this issue: so every time the screen rotation is detected, it will start the onStart() method in that activity. Currently, the "let's start tapping!" screen will restart everytime I rotate the screen on the "tap the heart to the beat" one and restart the entire song library again. Has to be fixed!

![rotationworking](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8041686/12491458/c5ac5c80-c040-11e5-8377-ca0c833e0ac4.png)

Created buttons with texts instead of using one image! + fonts... are ugly but will find a way to add a font to the android studio and change it afterwards :)

![rotationworkoutnotworking](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8041686/12491537/440ae84e-c041-11e5-98ac-a63bf2806ebb.png)

Adapting for rotation not working for the workouts; I'm thinking whether we want the same layout for the horizontal one. Would it be better if we had a different layout?

For the workouts, it might work better if they're displayed in a row, like
this.  ... | ...  | ..., so yeah,  you'll have to change the layout.

The main screen looks great though!  And it wouldn't be too hard to fix the
tapping on start issue.  I'll open a separate issue for that.

With [commit 8b0f588](https://github.com/jemitk/Pacer/commit/8b0f58896f7e4d6f1876bcd949c44bc8102d936a), this should be fixed.  UI flow should ask the user to allow access, informing them why we need it if need be, and then telling them that we can't do anything if we still don't have access. Closing this issue until I can test on a real device.

Yeah... I think there was some problem with the sql statement!

I don't really see why the sql statement did not work... though.
So before the fix, it was:

String selection = "? EQUALS ? AND ? EQUALS ?";
String[] selectionArgs = {SongBPMEntry.COLUMN_NAME_ARTIST,
        song.getArtist(),
        SongBPMEntry.COLUMN_NAME_TITLE,
        song.getTitle()};

and I have tried:

1

String selection = "? EQUALS ? AND ? EQUALS ?";
String[] selectionArgs = {SongBPMEntry.COLUMN_NAME_ARTIST,
        "\'" + song.getArtist() + "\'",
        SongBPMEntry.COLUMN_NAME_TITLE,
        "\'" + song.getTitle() + "\'"};

since artists and titles are in string, but it did not work.

I also have tried:

2

String selection = "?=? AND ?=?";
String[] selectionArgs = {SongBPMEntry.COLUMN_NAME_ARTIST,
        "\'" + song.getArtist() + "\'",
        SongBPMEntry.COLUMN_NAME_TITLE,
        "\'" + song.getTitle() + "\'"};

this one didn't work too.

now, I am comparing the song id's to delete it.

String selection = SongBPMEntry.COLUMN_NAME_SONG_ID + "=?";
String[] selectionArgs = {Long.toString(song.getID())};

and it seems to work. :)

2016-01-21 19:25 GMT-06:00 Bryce Willey notifications@github.com:

> Assigned #4 https://github.com/jemitk/Pacer/issues/4 to @jemitk
> https://github.com/jemitk.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/jemitk/Pacer/issues/4#event-522435429.
I'm closing the issue! :)
Checking the treadmills is the best option. I know of some off the top of my head (intervals, consistent, increasing) , but not that detailed.
Confirmed fixed.

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/6315908/which-activity-method-is-called-when-orientation-changes-occur

So it seems like it goes through onPause -> onSaveInstanceState -> onStop -> onCreate -> onStart -> onResume

I was thinking about this for a while... and the simplist fix will be not allowing people to rotate the screen. This solution makes sense because probably it's not a great idea to rotate the screen while you are tapping to the songs. This solution might be the nice solution for us, the programmers mainly since we don't have to keep track of the songs that the users already tapped too.

True.  It seems like bad coding practice, but it works. The only other arguments that I can think of are being able to re-start when the user leaves and then comes back, but even then, we'd want to start from scratch (maybe?)...  Apparently we can just mark the layout as only vertical, and that'll prevent it from changing, so I'll add that now.  

If we close this, we should figure out a way to deal with the song input better then. For people with 100's of songs, they'll have to stay on Pacer for a long time (~10-20minutes) without navigating away. I'm planning to refactor the BPMMusicFinderActivity for [issue 5](https://github.com/jemitk/Pacer/issues/5)  anyways, so maybe it'll turn out to be really easy to keep track of what they tapped after that.
Tested, and the fix of adding "screenOrientation = "portrait"" works.  Do we want to call this closed for now, or should we start re-thinking our input on a larger scale here?
Finished with the latest [commit](https://github.com/jemitk/Pacer/commit/54e2678612a9079cdfedc5247c0f6d76b7f82541).

Added this functionality in [this commit](https://github.com/jemitk/Pacer/commit/dd8a3c2c6b1d696c3183c943e4dc1c62ebd4d549).  It's really buggy though, and most definitely is not ready for release. I'll make separate issues for each problem when we find it.
Calling closed for now. We have other things to worry about.
I know this project has been dead for a month or so, but any updates on this?  If we want to get to the Google Play store, it's pretty critical that we sort this particular issue out.

I'll make one similar, but not with that exact gif file; I'll use the
images with open to public usage & modification!
